pr_title: Inconsistencies in ScreenManager behavior if displayCapabilities is null & revisions

timeline.message: Fixed WindowCapability logic in BaseText and graphic manager

Added three methods to WindowCapability  to be used in managers of the ScreenManager

hasImageFieldOfName,  hasTextFieldOfName, getMaxNumberOfMainFieldLines
Aligned how java uses WindowCapability  in TextAndGraphicManager  with IOS
Updated MenuManager handling of WindowCapability to align with IOS
Added ManagerUtility to extend capabilities of WindowCapability, Removed added methods from WindowCapability and added them to ManagerUtility.WindowCapabilityUtility
Deprecated hasTextFieldOfName and hasImageFieldOfName, changed where they were used to use ManagerUtility.WindowCapability methods
Changed logic to use new Class and methods in ManagerUtility.WindowCapabilityUtility
Moved ManagerUtility class and created symlink
Removed Method that was added by mistake
Moved this class to base managers
Added check back that checks if capability is null
Removed old test that get covered in newly added test testShouldSendText
Update getMaxNumberOfMainFieldLines to align with iOS
Update T&G manager capability handling to align with iOS
Remove some duplicate code from TextAndGraphicManager
Simplify some helper methods in screen manager

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (windowCapability == null) {
if (windowCapability == null || name == null) {
timeline.author: joeygrover

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
if (field != null && field.getName() != null && field.getName().equals(name)) {
if (field != null && name.equals(field.getName())) {
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: If we add the null check to name above, we can avoid the null check to field.getName().
replies.author: joeygrover

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
name = field.getName();
if (name == TextFieldName.mainField1 || name == TextFieldName.mainField2 || name == TextFieldName.mainField3 || name == TextFieldName.mainField4) {
int fieldNumber = Integer.parseInt(name.toString().substring(name.toString().length() - 1));
highestFound = Math.max(highestFound, fieldNumber);
if (highestFound == 4) {
break;
}
}
int fieldNumber =0;
switch (textField.getName()){
case mainField1:
fieldNumber = 1;
break;
case mainField2:
fieldNumber = 2;
break;
case mainField3:
fieldNumber = 3;
break;
case mainField4:
fieldNumber = 4;
break;
}
if(fieldNumber > 0){
highestFound = Math.max(highestFound, fieldNumber);
if (highestFound == 4) {
break;
}
}
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: While the current solution is more adaptable/clever, the reality is that there are only 4 specific cases that we care about and therefore should avoid string manipulation. I suggest not taking this suggestions from github, but making the changes in Android Studio.
replies.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: I agree that the suggested code should be better in performance. I will update the method.
replies.author: bilal-alsharifi

timeline.body: Does it max sense to just alter the utility method call to return 4 by default instead of this long inline if statement? This is not a hard requirement and would be interested to know how iOS handles it.
timeline.bodyText: Does it max sense to just alter the utility method call to return 4 by default instead of this long inline if statement? This is not a hard requirement and would be interested to know how iOS handles it.
timeline.bodyHTML: Does it max sense to just alter the utility method call to return 4 by default instead of this long inline if statement? This is not a hard requirement and would be interested to know how iOS handles it.
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText:
We kind of abstracted the logic in the helper methods in ManagerUtility to just return the actually supported things. And we kept the implementation for the rule "if null, then all enabled" directly in the manager's implementation. Of course, that is not a hard rule. We can apply the suggestion if you think that makes more sense. I just did it this way for alignment purposes as iOS implementation also does it similarly:
https://github.com/smartdevicelink/sdl_ios/blob/d4bd0eed98cb1e872da5bcd4a62b04d81a87f815/SmartDeviceLink/SDLTextAndGraphicManager.m#L315:
replies.author: bilal-alsharifi

replies.bodyText: If that's how iOS does it then staying aligned is more important right now. We can always address a better method for both in the future.
replies.author: joeygrover

timeline.body: I don't believe this logic is correct. Based on the RPC spec, the `imageField` array is not mandatory. Therefore if it is not included, we should infer that it is not supported, right? @joeljfischer can you confirm?
timeline.bodyText: I don't believe this logic is correct. Based on the RPC spec, the imageField array is not mandatory. Therefore if it is not included, we should infer that it is not supported, right? @joeljfischer can you confirm?
timeline.bodyHTML: I don't believe this logic is correct. Based on the RPC spec, the imageField array is not mandatory. Therefore if it is not included, we should infer that it is not supported, right? @joeljfischer can you confirm?
timeline.author: joeygrover

timeline.body: Is there a reason why this methods are `shouldSend____Text` instead of something more like `is___TextSupported`?
timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason why this methods are shouldSend____Text instead of something more like is___TextSupported?
timeline.bodyHTML: Is there a reason why this methods are shouldSend____Text instead of something more like is___TextSupported?
timeline.author: joeygrover

replies.bodyText: No reason other than following the iOS naming to make them easier to compare and maintain in the future. If you prefer changing the names, I suggest removing these 5 methods and call templateSupports___Field() directly.
replies.author: bilal-alsharifi

replies.bodyText: If this matches iOS then we can keep these for now. I would like to revisit for both after this release if possible. The naming doesn't make sense in my opinion.
replies.author: joeygrover

timeline.body: Same question before around if the `imageField` array is null. @joeljfischer for visibility.
timeline.bodyText: Same question before around if the imageField array is null. @joeljfischer for visibility.
timeline.bodyHTML: Same question before around if the imageField array is null. @joeljfischer for visibility.
